events.message: The applicant submitted a personal loan request to cover upcoming medical expenses and consolidate existing debt.
The loan application was reviewed and categorised under Personal Loan due to its mention of medical bills and debt repayment.
A loan officer with experience in handling medical and personal loans was assigned to manage this case.
The loan officer conducted an initial review of the submitted documents and application details and noted the need for further information.
Additional documents including medical bills, proof of income, and current debt statements were requested from the applicant.
The applicant promptly submitted all requested documents, including detailed income verification and medical receipts.
A credit report was obtained showing a fair credit score with some outstanding debts, consistent with the applicant's disclosures.
Risk assessment identified moderate risk due to existing debts but did not find any urgent red flags for loan denial.
A loan offer with competitive interest rates and a favorable repayment plan was presented to the applicant for review.
The applicant responded positively, requesting minor adjustments to the repayment schedule to accommodate vacation plans.
The application was escalated to a senior manager for approval of the modified repayment terms requested by the applicant.
The senior manager approved the personal loan with the requested repayment revisions, allowing the applicant flexibility.
Loan funds were disbursed directly to the applicant’s bank account to cover medical bills and consolidate debts as planned.
A follow-up call was made to confirm the applicant’s satisfaction with the loan and to check the status of repayments.
The loan application case was formally closed after successful funding and initial follow-up with the applicant.
